text: In Search of the Last Good Man is a Canadian comedy-drama short film, directed by Peg Campbell and released in 1989."Video festival is giving a voice to women artists". Calgary Herald, November 26, 1989. Cowritten with Peggy Thompson as a followup to their 1986 short film It's a Party!,"Few writers meet Telefilm standards". The Globe and Mail, August 17, 1990. the film blends live action and animation to depict a group of women in a coffee shop talking about their relationships with men. Campbell described the film as "an experiment in camera movement, using a dolly to create a constant sense of swooping movement.""Keeping an eye on the dark side". The Globe and Mail, December 1, 1990. The film won the Genie Award for Best Live Action Short Drama at the 11th Genie Awards."Jesus of Montreal in near sweep: Vancouver actress wins a Genie award".
